column4: i have windows 7 installed in one hard drive and ubuntu installed on another seperate hard drive. even after changing the bios boot order options, windows 7 wont boot. it just goes straight to ubuntu. anyone know why?
run sudo update-grub in ubuntu
did windows show in the terminal?
run the script the bot will show and pastebin the results.txt
hold on I will get youn the link
run this script in ubuntu and pastebin the results.txt http://bootinfoscript.sourceforge.net/
cool hold on

couple of problems you need a boot flag on the windows partition and you need these files to boot it  /bootmgr /Boot/BCD I can help you do thi if you have a W7 recovery or install disc. You also appear to have a boot partition sda1 that you don't need.
you need the files I posted to boot windows in the windows partition.
windows will not boot without these.  /bootmgr /Boot/BCD
you should see this Boot files:        /bootmgr /Boot/BCD  /Windows/System32/winload.exe
easy fix with a recovery or install disc of W7.

cool you need to install gparted in ubuntu and put a boot flag on the sdb1 partition I can give you the commands to load those files using the repair terminal from the booted W7 disc, this will not work if you do not put that bootflag on the windows partition first.
cool do you have a W7 recovery or install disc or thumb that can be booted?
yep. :)
cool
no problem.:)
cool boot it and follow these instructions there is a W7 forum link for orientation if needed. http://paste.ubuntu.com/813664/
cool you will get a chkdsk prompt to run on reboot, you will need to boot straight to winows or into ubuntu to run sudo update-grub to add the windows to grub.
is it the same 32bit or 64bit?
not sure on that you might try the ##windows channel.
strange realy NTLDR is XP I believe.
